Meta.title: Progress Meeting 8/11/2023
attendees: Emma, Raj, Olivia, Noah, Mia, Liam, Ava

agenda: 1. What went well during the last Sprint?
2. What didn't go well during the last Sprint?
3. Brainstorming solutions to improve Sprint planning and time management
4. Identifying areas of improvement for backlog refinement sessions
5. Determining action items based on discussions
summary: - The meeting began with Emma acknowledging the team's punctuality and introducing the agenda.
- Raj commended the team for the successful release and positive feedback from stakeholders.
- The team discussed what went well during the last Sprint, including focused and efficient daily stand-ups, productive pair programming, and time-saving automated testing.
- They also discussed challenges, such as overcommitment, lack of time for design reviews, and potential improvements required in Sprint planning and time management.
- Emma suggested setting a hard limit on story points and refining the estimation process as possible solutions.
- Mia proposed scheduling design reviews earlier in the Sprint to allow for more iteration.
- Liam pointed out the need for better organization and structure during backlog refinement sessions.
- Raj took responsibility for improving the definition of user stories before the refinement sessions.

- Emma summarized the discussion, outlining the action items: implementing a hard limit on story points, refining estimation process, scheduling design reviews earlier, and structuring backlog refinement sessions.
- The team confirmed agreement with the action items and concluded the retrospective.
- Emma assured the team that she would send out the action items and meeting notes by the end of the day.

Emma:: Send out the action items and meeting notes by the end of the day.
Raj:: Ensure user stories are better defined before the backlog refinement session.
Liam and Olivia:: Establish a more structured agenda and stricter timeboxes for backlog refinement sessions.

Improve the estimation process by factoring in the complexity of user stories.

jira_tickets.title: Refine Sprint Planning and Time Management
jira_tickets.description: Improve the Sprint planning process and time management by implementing a hard limit on the number of story points per Sprint and refining the estimation process.
jira_tickets.acceptanceCriteria: The team should establish a maximum number of story points for each Sprint and ensure that estimation takes into account the complexity of user stories. The improvements should result in better planning and reduced stress levels.
jira_tickets.userStory: As a team member, I want to have a well-defined Sprint plan and effective time management practices to ensure that we are able to deliver the planned work without unnecessary stress.

jira_tickets.title: Schedule Design Reviews Earlier in the Sprint
jira_tickets.description: Improve the design review process by scheduling it earlier in the Sprint to allow more time for iteration based on feedback.
jira_tickets.acceptanceCriteria: The team should agree on a specific timeframe for the design review and ensure it is scheduled earlier in the Sprint. This change should provide sufficient time for incorporating feedback into the design work.
jira_tickets.userStory: As a designer, I want to have sufficient time to iterate on designs based on feedback received during the design review, so that the end result meets the requirements and expectations.

jira_tickets.title: Improve Backlog Refinement Sessions
jira_tickets.description: Enhance the effectiveness of backlog refinement sessions by introducing a structured agenda and stricter timeboxes for discussions.
jira_tickets.acceptanceCriteria: The team should collaborate to create a structured agenda for backlog refinement sessions and establish timeboxes for each discussion point. The aim is to improve organization, eliminate confusion, and maintain a focused and productive session.
jira_tickets.userStory: As a team member, I want our backlog refinement sessions to be well-organized and time-efficient, so that we can effectively prioritize and refine user stories for future Sprints.

jira_tickets.title: Actions from Sprint Retrospective
jira_tickets.description: Implement the agreed-upon action items from the Sprint Retrospective, including setting a hard limit on story points, refining the estimation process, scheduling design reviews earlier, and structuring backlog refinement sessions.
jira_tickets.acceptanceCriteria: The identified improvements and actions should be implemented following the agreed timeline. The team should observe the changes and ensure they result in better planning, improved design iterations, and more efficient backlog refinement sessions.
jira_tickets.userStory: As a team lead, I want to see the actionable items from the Sprint Retrospective implemented to improve our processes and ultimately deliver better results.

jira_tickets.title: Meeting Notes and Action Items Distribution
jira_tickets.description: Distribute the meeting notes and action items from the Sprint Retrospective to all participants by the end of the day.
jira_tickets.acceptanceCriteria: Meeting notes should be comprehensive and include a summary of discussions, agreed-upon action items, and responsibilities. The meeting notes and action items should be distributed to all relevant team members promptly.
jira_tickets.userStory: As a team member, I want to receive the meeting notes and action items promptly after the Sprint Retrospective, so that I can review and act upon them as necessary.

transcript:
Date: 8/11/2023
Time: 2:00 PM – 2:22 PM
Location: Online


Emma [2:00 PM]: Good afternoon, everyone. Thank you for being on time. Let's get started with our Sprint Retrospective. As usual, we'll be reflecting on the last Sprint—what went well, what didn't, and how we can improve moving forward. Let's make sure we keep this a safe space for honest and constructive feedback.
Raj [2:02 PM]: Thanks, Emma. Before we dive into the details, I want to commend the team for the successful release. The feedback from our stakeholders has been overwhelmingly positive.
Emma [2:03 PM]: That's great to hear, Raj. Now, let's start with our first agenda item: what went well during the last Sprint? We can use the whiteboard for this. Please, go ahead and shout out your thoughts.
Olivia [2:04 PM]: I'll start. I think our daily stand-ups have become more focused and efficient. We managed to keep them under 15 minutes each time, which helped us quickly address issues and not get bogged down.
Noah [2:05 PM]: Agreed. Also, the pair programming initiative between Liam and me has really paid off. We’ve closed twice as many bugs as the last Sprint.
Mia [2:06 PM]: The new automated testing suite that I’ve been working on has decreased the time I spend on regression tests by about 40%.
Emma [2:07 PM]: Those are great points. Now, let’s talk about what didn’t go so well. Remember, this isn’t about assigning blame; it’s about improvement.
Liam [2:08 PM]: On that note, I think we over-committed this Sprint. We managed to get everything done, but it was a close call, and the stress levels were higher than necessary.
Ava [2:09 PM]: Yeah, and I felt like the design review got squeezed in at the last minute, which didn’t give us much time to iterate based on feedback.
Raj [2:10 PM]: I see. It sounds like we need to work on our Sprint planning and time management. Any thoughts on how we can improve these areas?
Emma [2:11 PM]: Good points. Let's brainstorm some potential solutions. How about we have a hard limit on the number of story points per Sprint?
Noah [2:12 PM]: That might work, but we also need to factor in the complexity of the user stories better. Perhaps we can refine our estimation process?
Mia [2:13 PM]: What if we scheduled the design review earlier in the Sprint? That could give us more wiggle room for iteration.
Emma [2:14 PM]: Great suggestions. I'll note these down, and we can decide on the action items at the end. Moving on to the next point: what can we improve?
Liam [2:15 PM]: I’d like to see us improve our backlog refinement sessions. They're a bit disorganized, which sometimes leads to confusion during the Sprint.
Olivia [2:16 PM]: I agree with Liam. Maybe we can have a more structured agenda for those sessions and stricter timeboxes for each discussion point.
Raj [2:17 PM]: I’ll take responsibility for that. I’ll make sure the user stories are better defined before we go into the refinement session.
Emma [2:18 PM]: Alright. Now let’s turn these discussions into action items. Here’s what I’ve gathered: We will set a hard limit on story points, improve our estimation process, schedule design reviews earlier, and structure our backlog refinement sessions better. Does that cover everything?
Team [2:19 PM]: [Various affirmations]
Emma [2:20 PM]: Excellent. If no one has anything else to add, we’ll conclude our retrospective. Thanks for the open discussion, team. I’ll send out the action items and meeting notes by the end of the day. Enjoy the rest of your afternoon!
Raj [2:21 PM]: Thanks, Emma. Good meeting, everyone.
Participants: [Murmurs of agreement]
Emma [2:22 PM]: Meeting adjourned.
